title: New WeWork chairman vows to deliver 'one of the most amazing comebacks in history'
text:
The new chairman of WeWork has pledged to deliver “one of the most amazing comebacks in history” as the firm prepares to axe thousands of jobs following a last-ditch rescue deal.

Marcelo Claure told employees at the office rental company that there is now “zero risk of the company going bankrupt” after it agreed to a $9.5bn (£7.3bn) bail-out package from Japanese telecoms conglomerate SoftBank.

The business is reportedly planning to cut as many as 5,000 employees as it seeks to improve its finances.

The cuts could affect 1,000 cleaners and replace them with agency contractors.

Mr Claure joined the firm from SoftBank, where he works as chief financial officer.
description: The new chairman of WeWork has pledged to deliver “one of the most amazing comebacks in history” as the firm prepares to axe thousands of jobs following a last-ditch rescue deal.
